sentences: Keera gaas kinni, supp on juba keenud.
Gaasi andma, lisama 'mootors천idukit liikuma panema v. liikumiskiirust suurendama'.
Gaasi p천hja vajutama 'mootors천idukile suurimat liikumiskiirust andma'.
translation: add gas/to accelerate a vehicle/increase speed
press the gas pedal to give maximum speed
context: The word 'keera' in Estonian is an imperative form meaning 'to turn'. When used with 'gaas' (gas), it forms the phrase 'keera gaas kinni' which means 'turn off the gas'. In driving contexts, it's part of expressions like 'gaasi andma' (adding gas) and 'gaasi p천hja vajutama' (pressing the gas pedal). It can refer to both actual gas appliances and vehicle acceleration.
